increasing the number of chains from 1.09 eV (single chain)
to 0.54 eV (bulk). The band structures of single, double, triple,
and septuple SCAC bundles were similar, but they were
diﬀerent from that of the bulk structure. We investigated the
eﬀects of vdW interchain interactions by adding the dispersion
energy correction to the structural optimization. The
dispersion energy decreased the band gaps but did not alter
the indirect-to-direct band gap transition trend signiﬁcantly,
whereas the dispersion energy was important in predicting the
direct band gap of the double-layer MoS
shows the calculated band structures of bulk and few-

Full band structures can be found in
S5. Unlike 2D materials, a collection of 1D
materials can have various arrangements. The lowest energy
arrangements of the double and triple chains were chosen for
the band structure calculation. Triangular arrangement of
is more stable than linear V
implies that aggregation stabilizes the energy of V
Thus, we calculated the band structure of hexagonally stacked
septuple-chain bundles for seven chains. As
had an indirect band gap of 0.54 eV from point
However, all 1D few-chain systems had direct band gaps that
increased as the number of chains decreased. The maximum
band gap was 1.09 eV in a single chain. Direct band gaps
, a local minimum point in the conduction

was a local energy maximum in the few-
chain system, unlike in the bulk system. The band energies of
chains increased in the few-chain systems. However, the
increased with the number of few-
chain systems, whereas the conduction band energy of
bulk was minimal. This implies that the stacking eﬀect on the
in the bulk is diﬀerent from that in the few-

). The diﬀerent aspects of the conduction band near
is the reason that bulk V
diﬀerence between the valence bands of bulk and few-chain
systems is much smaller than the diﬀerence between the
conduction bands. The number of chains has little inﬂuence on
the valence band of few-chain and bulk V

bands of SCACs and bulk are also similar in both Nb
. The contribution of selenium is greater than that of
vanadium to the partial density of state both for the bulk and
few-chain systems except the double chain (
Screening of inner vanadium ions by outer selenium ions
prevents the conduction band from being perturbed by other
chains. The interactions between chains mainly change the
characteristics related to selenium ions. However, the few
chains have electronic bands with many valleys, whereas
All few-chain systems calculated previously have similar
properties to a single chain. To determine the boundary
between such few-chain systems and bulk systems, we plotted
the changes in the band gap for a number of V
. The band gap decreases as the number
of chains increases, as does the change of the band gap. We
expected that a decrease in the band gap (
) would approach the band gap in bulk V
at 0.65 eV. We interpolated the tendency
